img.alt: Half Hollow Hills Thanks Our First Responders & Medical Professionals

div.a: Half Hollow Hills Thanks Our First Responders & Medical Professionals

div.p: Half Hollow Hills thanks all of the many first responders and medical professionals in our community for their vital and tireless work during this pandemic, putting their health on the line to protect the health of others!

article.a: Read Article about Half Hollow Hills Thanks Our First Responders & Medical Professionals

img.alt: Half Hollow Hills Helps To Raise Over $157k For Students Rebuild Hunger Challenge

div.a: Half Hollow Hills Helps To Raise Over $157k For Students Rebuild Hunger Challenge

div.p: To date, the Half Hollow Hills students participating in the Students Rebuild Hunger Challenge have submitted 26,176 pieces of art, helping to raise a total of $157,056 to help battle childhood hunger!

article.a: Read Article about Half Hollow Hills Helps To Raise Over $157k For Students Rebuild Hunger Challenge

img.alt: East Artists Awarded National Art Honor Society Scholarships

div.a: East Artists Awarded National Art Honor Society Scholarships

div.p: Congratulations to the 2020 Hills East National Art Honor Society Scholarship recipients!

article.a: Read Article about East Artists Awarded National Art Honor Society Scholarships

img.alt: West's Erica Chen Named Newsday's Fencer Of The Year

div.a: West's Erica Chen Named Newsday's Fencer Of The Year

div.p: Congratulations to Hills West's Erica Chen on being named Newsday's Fencer of the Year and a member of the All-Long Island girls fencing team for the 2019-20 winter season!

article.a: Read Article about West's Erica Chen Named Newsday's Fencer Of The Year

img.alt: Half Hollow Hills Students Light It Up Blue

div.a: Half Hollow Hills Students Light It Up Blue

div.p: Paumanok, West Hollow and Candlewood siblings wore blue as part of the #LightItUpBlue campaign in celebration of World Autism Day, helping to increase the awareness that leads to understanding and acceptance for those impacted by Autism.

article.a: Read Article about Half Hollow Hills Students Light It Up Blue

img.alt: East's Remi Sisselman Selected For Newsday's All-Long Island Girls Basketball Team

div.a: East's Remi Sisselman Selected For Newsday's All-Long Island Girls Basketball Team

div.p: Congratulations to Hills East's Remi Sisselman on being selected for Newsday's All-Long Island girls basketball first team for the 2019-20 winter season.

article.a: Read Article about East's Remi Sisselman Selected For Newsday's All-Long Island Girls Basketball Team

img.alt: Candlewood Musicians Selected For SCMEA Division I and Division II Festival

div.a: Candlewood Musicians Selected For SCMEA Division I and Division II Festival

div.p: Congratulations to our Candlewood Musicians who were selected for the SCMEA Division I and Division II Festival.

article.a: Read Article about Candlewood Musicians Selected For SCMEA Division I and Division II Festival

img.alt: East's Jillian Martin Earns Perfect Score On ACT

div.a: East's Jillian Martin Earns Perfect Score On ACT

div.p: Congratulations to Hills East's Jillian Martin on her outstanding performance on the ACT test. Jillian earned a perfect score, 36, the highest possible composite score.

article.a: Read Article about East's Jillian Martin Earns Perfect Score On ACT

img.alt: Paumanok Students Win Women of Distinction Awards

div.a: Paumanok Students Win Women of Distinction Awards

div.p: Congratulations to Paumanok's Alexia Karagiannis and Liana Osman on being recognized as part of the art contest in Assemblywoman Kimberly Jean-Pierre's Women of Distinction Awards!

article.a: Read Article about Paumanok Students Win Women of Distinction Awards

img.alt: March Elementary Connects Activity Helps First Graders Develop Problem Solving Skills

div.a: March Elementary Connects Activity Helps First Graders Develop Problem Solving Skills

div.p: First graders across the district worked together to further develop their problem solving skills during March's Elementary Connects activity.

article.a: Read Article about March Elementary Connects Activity Helps First Graders Develop Problem Solving Skills

img.alt: Three Students Win At Long Island Science And Engineering Fair

div.a: Three Students Win At Long Island Science And Engineering Fair

div.p: Congratulations to Hills West's Poojan Pandya, and Hills East's Megan Gole and Cassandra Ye on placing 1st place at the Long Island Science and Engineering Fair!

article.a: Read Article about Three Students Win At Long Island Science And Engineering Fair

img.alt: Congratulations To The Top 20 Students From High School East And High School West

div.a: Congratulations To The Top 20 Students From High School East And High School West

div.p: Congratulations to the Top 20 students from each of our graduating classes at Hills East and West!

img.alt: Hills West Students Win & Place At 2020 Chemagination Competition

div.a: Hills West Students Win & Place At 2020 Chemagination Competition

div.p: Congratulations to our Science Research students from Hills West who won or placed at the 2020 American Chemical Society Chemagination Competition!

img.alt: PTSA Legislation Committee Visits Representatives In Albany

div.a: PTSA Legislation Committee Visits Representatives In Albany

div.p: Members of the Half Hollow Hills PTSA Legislation Committee recently visited Albany to meet with our state representatives and share with them our district's legislative priorities.

img.alt: Half Hollow Hills Central School District

div.div: 525 Half Hollow Road Dix Hills, New York 11746

a.title: Powered by Finalsite opens in a new window

div.a: Powered by Finalsite

div.p: Governor Cuomo has announced that all schools in New York will be closed until at least May 15. We understand that extended closures may impact many of the year-end celebrations that mean so much to all of us in Half Hollow Hills. Please know that we are evaluating all possible scheduling options and alternative ways to conduct these celebrations, including:
1. Whenever possible, postponing and rescheduling individual events to run as usual.
2. Using existing dates to conduct events in alternative formats.
3. Recognizing student achievements in different ways.

We are committed to the safety of our students, staff and families, and will follow any directives or guidance provided by federal, state or local officials. Within those bounds, we will work with all stakeholders to develop a safe plan that allows us to recognize our students for their incredible accomplishments.

Please continue to practice social distancing during this emergency closure to protect yourselves, your families, and our community at large. Visit our Health Services webpage for the latest developments and answers to frequently asked questions.
